quest.name: Your Inventory Is Not Full
journal:
 Quest Sync
Keeping tabs on its supplies does not appear to be the Ilsabard contingent's forte.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: I've an important task to perform, and by that, I mean “have someone else perform.”

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: I've been lumbered with the unenviable duty of keeping inventory of supplies brought by each delegation. Though weaponry and basic provisions have been accounted for, I can't say the same for what might be considered...creature comforts.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: You see, even the most frivolous of things can make a huge difference out here in the frozen wastes, so I'm trying to put together a list of the luxury goods at our disposal. Seeing as you're on good terms with practically everyone here─better than me, at any rate─perhaps you could help?

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: Much appreciated. I've already sent one of my subordinates to speak with the Maelstrom, Temple Knights, and Ala Mhigan Resistance.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: I need you to ask the remaining groups, namely the Twin Adders, Immortal Flames, and our Far Eastern allies. Any information you can bring me would be most welcome.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: It's not important who you ask, as long as they know what they're talking about!

dialogue.name: JUNE
dialogue.text: Creature comforts? Well, we did bring a large shipment of tea leaves provided by the Carline Canopy.

dialogue.name: JUNE
dialogue.text: Mother Miounne and Fufucha both agreed that there's no better way to stave off the cold than a nice, hot brew, and I can personally attest to that! We've enough for everyone if they've a mind to try it.

dialogue.name: MENUKI
dialogue.text: Hmm... There is one thing that springs to mind. We brought several bolts of felt, which might seem a bit odd to some.

dialogue.name: MENUKI
dialogue.text: Most people don't realize how effective it is in keeping the cold out and the warm in, and that's not all. We use it in everything from clothing, to our yurts, and even for patching up wounds! Of course, we're more than willing to share it with the rest of the contingent.

dialogue.name: MENUKI
dialogue.text: We also have a whole crate of what you might call “warming stones” in the common tongue. Hold one in your hands and you'll see what I mean. There are plenty of those to go around as well.

dialogue.name: KOCHACHA
dialogue.text: Let me see... Other than the usual materiel, we also have a number of tents donated by Lord Lolorito.

dialogue.name: KOCHACHA
dialogue.text: A few of them have been pitched around the camp, and you might be interested to know they were woven by Ala Mhigan refugees. We're all glad they've found meaningful employment, and the quality of their work speaks for itself.

dialogue.name: KOCHACHA
dialogue.text: We do appear, however, to have overestimated how many tents we would need, and find ourselves with a surplus of cloth. We soon discovered, however, that when folded up, the tent sheets make for surprisingly good bedding. I'd be happy to donate a few.

dialogue.name: JUNE
dialogue.text: I'm told some of the varieties of herbal tea we've brought have medicinal properties, though I have trouble remembering what does what.

dialogue.name: MENUKI
dialogue.text: With a lining of felt and a warming stone in your hand, you'll soon forget all about these freezing conditions! ...Well, almost.

dialogue.name: KOCHACHA
dialogue.text: While I'm sure the weavers would balk at their cloth being used for anything other than its intended purpose, their hard work is appreciated all the same.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: Do the others have anything to share?

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: Yes, that will do nicely. What's more, the Temple Knights, Maelstrom, and Ala Mhigan Resistance had a fair few useful supplies of their own, so my list of creature comforts is a lot longer than I was expecting.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: In all honesty, I was worried that taking in all those imperials might put everyone, including them, in a very unfavorable position. Even those of us most committed to the cause might find it hard to put the needs of our former enemies before those of our sworn comrades.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: A valid point, perhaps, until you stop to consider the terrible fate that has befallen Garlemald. I wouldn't wish that on anyone... In any case, they're the reason we're here in the first place, so it's our duty to lend them what aid we can.

dialogue.name: OFFICER04219
dialogue.text: Ah, listen to me ramble on! Anyway, for your part in making our lives a little more bearable, please accept this as a token of my gratitude.
